revisions.rev:
The following is a list of notable [[file system]] [[defragmentation]] software.
==Commercial== * [[Ashampoo Magical Defrag]], by [[Ashampoo]], for [[Windows XP]], [[Windows Vista|Vista]], and [[Windows 7|7]] (including [[64-bit]] versions) * [[Disk Defragmenter (Windows)|Disk Defragmenter]], by [[Diskeeper Corporation]] and [[Microsoft]], included in most versions of [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] * [[Diskeeper]], by Diskeeper Corporation, for Windows XP or higher * [[Norton SpeedDisk]] (a component of the [[Norton Utilities]] bundle), by [[Symantec]], for [[DOS]] and Windows * [[Norton SystemWorks]] (Speed-Disk), by Symantec, for [[Hierarchical File System|HFS]] ([[Mac OS X]]) and [[HFS Plus]] * [[O&O Defrag]], by O&O Software, for Windows 2000, XP, Server 2003, Vista, Server 2008, and 7 (including 64-bit versions) * [[PerfectDisk]], by Raxco Software, for Windows 2000, XP, Server 2003, Vista, Server 2008, and 7 (including 64-bit versions) * [[UltimateDefrag]], by Disktrix, for Windows 2000, XP, Server 2003, Vista, Server 2008, and 7 (including 64-bit versions) * [[Vopt]], by GoldenBow, for Windows 2000, XP, Server 2003, Vista, Server 2008, and 7 (including 64-bit versions)
==Freeware== * [[Contig (defragmentation utility)|Contig]], by [[Winternals|Windows Sysinternals]], for Windows XP, Server 2003, and higher<ref>{{Cite web|title=Contig v1.6|url=http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/bb897428.aspx|first=Mark|last=Russinovich|publisher=Microsoft|work=Windows Sysinternals|date=February 1, 2011|accessdate=June 9, 2011}}</ref> * [[Defraggler]], by [[Piriform (company)|Piriform]], for Windows XP, Server 2003, Vista, Server 2008, and 7 (including 64-bit versions) * [[DiskTune]], by DIY DataRecovery, for Windows XP, Server 2003, Vista, Server 2008, and 7 (including 64-bit versions) * [[MyDefrag]], by Jeroen Kessels, for Windows 2000, XP, Server 2003, Vista, Server 2008, and 7 (including 64-bit versions) * [[PageDefrag]], by Windows Sysinternals, for Windows XP (32-bit), Server 2003 (32-bit), and higher
==Open source== * [[JkDefrag]], by Jeroen Kessels (discontinued but still available; replaced by free but not open source MyDefrag) * [[UltraDefrag]], by Dmitri Arkhangelski, Justin Dearing, and Stefan Pendl, for [[Windows NT 4.0]], 2000, XP, Server 2003, Vista, Server 2008, and 7 (including 64-bit versions)
==See also== * [[Comparison of defragmentation software]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
